courses.name: Cellular and Molecular Neurobiology of the Synapse

cmCourseInfo.description: Examination of all aspects of the synapse in both the peripheral and central nervous systems of invertebrates and vertebrates. Topics include: neuroplasticity, synapse formation, synaptic transmission, synaptic modulation, and the molecular biological basis of neurodegenerative disorders.
cmCourseInfo.title: Cellular and Molecular Neurobiology of the Synapse

breadthTypes.description: BR=4 Living Things and Their Environment

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Delivery Instructions

Recorded online lectures and tutorials will be given as 2-3-hr online asynchronous videos/week available via Quercus for students to watch prior to online optional office hours. Students are advised to watch asynchronous lecture videos before participating in office hour meetings.The optional office hours will allow students to ask questions directly to the instructor or TAs to clarify and explore lecture/tutorial content. All optional office hours will be recorded and available for students to view at any time. It is recommended that students have a computer with a microphone in order to participate in online activities.
